meanings.definition: To take care of or look after someone or something.
meanings.sent1: I caretake my little sister when my parents are busy.
meanings.sent2: She carefully caretakes her plants by watering them regularly.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to caretake the fish tank, thinking the fish needed a friend.
meanings.sent4: The teacher caretook the students' safety like a guardian angel.
meanings.sent5: He caretakes the stray animals with so much love and dedication.

meanings.definition: A person who takes care of a property or person.
meanings.sent1: The caretaker of the park ensures it stays clean and beautiful.
meanings.sent2: My grandma is the caretaker of our family traditions.
meanings.sent3: The caretaker of the haunted house turned out to be a friendly ghost.
meanings.sent4: She became the caretaker of his heart, always looking out for him.
meanings.sent5: The caretaker of the lighthouse guided ships safely to shore.
